Package com.kneelawk.codextra.api.attach.stream

Class MutReadAttachingStreamCodec<B1 extends net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf,B2 extends net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf,K,V>

java.lang.Object
com.kneelawk.codextra.api.attach.stream.MutReadAttachingStreamCodec<B1,B2,K,V>
Type Parameters:
B1 - the buffer type of this stream codec.
B2 - the buffer type of the wrapped codec.
K - the key type.
V - the result type.
All Implemented Interfaces:
net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamCodec<B1,V>, net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamDecoder<B1,V>, net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamEncoder<B1,V>
public class MutReadAttachingStreamCodec<B1 extends net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf,B2 extends net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf,K,V> extends Object implements net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamCodec<B1,V>
A StreamCodec that decodes one value and uses it create attachments to attach to the context when decoding the result value, but that also allows mutation of the attachment while encoding, making sure those changes show up in the decoded key.

This is good for things like palettes.

  • Constructor Details

    • MutReadAttachingStreamCodec

      public MutReadAttachingStreamCodec(net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamCodec<? super B1,K> keyCodec, Function<? super K,? extends Map<AttachmentKey<?>,?>> attachmentsGetter, ChildBufferFactory<? super B1,B2> wrappedBufferCtor, net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamCodec<? super B2,V> wrappedCodec, Function<? super V,? extends K> keyGetter)
      Creates a new MutReadAttachingStreamCodec.
      Parameters:
      keyCodec - the codec for the key to be turned into attachments.
      attachmentsGetter - the function to turn the key into attachments.
      wrappedBufferCtor - for creating the buffer used by the wrapped codec, as writing wrapped codec values to the main buffer must be delayed.
      wrappedCodec - the codec to pass the attachments to.
      keyGetter - the function to get the key back from the result type. This may simply create a new key if the key is intended to get all its value from being mutated while encoding.

  • Method Details

    • single

      public static <A, B1 extends net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf, B2 extends net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf, V> MutReadAttachingStreamCodec<B1,B2,A,V> single(AttachmentKey<A> key, net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamCodec<? super B1,A> keyCodec, ChildBufferFactory<? super B1,B2> wrappedBufferCtor, net.minecraft.network.codec.StreamCodec<? super B2,V> wrappedCodec, Function<? super V,? extends A> keyGetter)
      Creates a new MutReadAttachingStreamCodec that uses its key as its single attachment.
      Type Parameters:
      A - the attachment type.
      B1 - the buffer type of this stream codec.
      B2 - the buffer type of the wrapped codec.
      V - the result type.
      Parameters:
      key - the attachment key.
      keyCodec - the codec for the attachment.
      wrappedBufferCtor - for creating the buffer used by the wrapped codec, as writing wrapped codec values to the main buffer must be delayed.
      wrappedCodec - the codec to pass the attachment to.
      keyGetter - a function for getting the attachment when given the result type. This may simply create a new attachment if the attachment is intended to get all its value from being mutated while encoding.
      Returns:
      the created stream codec.
